sen.j: 京丹波町（きょうたんばちょう）は、京都府中部の船井郡に属する町。
sen.e: Kyotanba-cho is the town located in Funai District, central Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyotanba-cho is a town located in Funai District, central Kyoto Prefecture.
Kyotanba-cho is a town located in Funai-gun, central Kyoto Prefecture.

sen.j: 2005年10月11日、丹波町、瑞穂町 (京都府)、和知町が市町村合併して誕生した。
sen.e: It was created from city and town unification of Tanba, Mizuho-cho (Mizuho Town) (Kyoto Prefecture) and Wachi-cho Towns on October 11, 2005.
It was created from the unification of Tanba, Mizuho-cho (Mizuho Town) (Kyoto Prefecture) and Wachi-cho Towns on October 11, 2005.
It was created from the unification of Tanba-cho, Mizuho-cho (Kyoto Prefecture) and Wachi-cho on October 11, 2005.

sen.j: 丹波地方の中央部、丹波高地を控え、旧丹波町の南部が淀川水系と由良川水系の分水界となっている。
sen.e: It has Tanba Highland located at the center of Tanba region, and the southern part of former Tanba Town divides the Yodo and Yura River systems.
Tanba Highland is located at the center of Tanba region, while the southern part of former Tanba Town divides the Yodo and Yura River systems.
Tanba Highland is located at the center of Tanba region, while the southern part of former Tanba-cho divides the Yodo-gawa and Yura-gawa River systems.

sen.j: 河川：由良川、高屋川、須知川
sen.e: Rivers: Yura, Takaya, and Shuchi Rivers
Rivers: Yura, Takaya, and Shuchi Rivers
Rivers: Yura-gawa, Takaya-gawa, and Shuchi-gawa Rivers

sen.j: 京都府
綾部市
福知山市
南丹市
兵庫県
篠山市
2005年（平成17年）10月11日：船井郡丹波町、瑞穂町 (京都府)、和知町の3町が対等市町村合併して誕生。
sen.e: October 11, 2005: Three towns of Tanba Town of Funai District, Mizuho Town (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi Town each joined City, Town, and Village Unification and Kyotanba-cho was created.
October 11, 2005: Three towns of Tanba Town of Funai District, Mizuho Town (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi Town were unified creating Kyotanba-cho.
October 11, 2005: Three towns of Tanba-cho of Funai-gun, Mizuho-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), and Wachi-cho were merged to establish Kyotanba-cho.
sen.cmt: xx-cho、 -gunのような表現にしました。

sen.j: 町長：松原茂樹（旧丹波町議会議長）
sen.e: Town Head: Shigeki MATSUBARA (the chairman of former Tanba Town Congress)
Town Head: Shigeki MATSUBARA (the chairman of former Tanba Town Congress)
Mayor: Shigeki MATSUBARA (the chairman of former Tanba Town Congress)

sen.j: 主な産業は、農業（ブドウ、稲作、酪農が中心）と林業。
sen.e: The main industries are agriculture (mainly grapes, rice-crop, and dairy farming) and forestry.
The main industries are agriculture (mainly grapes, rice-crop, and dairy farming) and forestry.
The main industries are agriculture (mainly grapes, rice-crop, and dairy farming) and forestry.

sen.j: 古くから丹波の名産を生む中心的地域で特産物は、以下の通りである。
sen.e: The special products original to this central Tanba region from long ago are
The special products original to this central Tanba region from long ago are

sen.j: 丹波マツタケ

Tanba Matsutake (mushroom noted for its nice aroma)
Tanba Matsutake (mushroom noted for its nice aroma)

sen.j: 丹波黒豆（特に、旧和知町で生産される「和知黒」は評価が高い）
sen.e: Tanba Black Soybean (especially "Wachikuro" produced in the former Wachi Town has a high reputation).
Tanba Black Soybean (especially "Wachikuro" produced in the former Wachi Town has a high reputation).
Tanba Black Soybean (especially 'Wachikuro' produced in the former Wachi-cho has a high reputation).

are some of many brands famous across Japan.

sen.j: 1988年6月7日に旧丹波町と姉妹都市提携。
sen.e: It became the sister city to the former Tanba Town on June 7, 1988.

sen.j: なお、旧瑞穂町 (京都府)、および旧丹波町南部には鉄道駅が無い。
sen.e: There were no railway stations in former Mizuho Town (Kyoto Prefecture) and southern former Tanba Town.

sen.j: これらの地域住民の中には、京都市方面へのアクセスに、南丹市にある園部駅を利用する者も多い。
sen.e: Some locals here use Sonobe Station at Nantan City to gain an access to Kyoto City.
